comments.text: Confirm it is still pretty easy to hitchhike, including on scooters

Hitchiking is the main means of transportation for most visitors, since bus service is very limited. Tourists with cars and locals know it and usually are glad to give you a ride. This part of the island near the camping sites, and especially this road junction is always busy, you won't have to wait long. Anyway, always have water with you when travelling since temperatures can be really hot.
Probably best spot to hitch out of Volos Pelion way
Just outside Anakasia square near large centaur statue. Traffic going all the way up Pilio
Was offered a ride across the border instantly and without asking.
Multaj homoj haltas ĉe la senimposta butiko, do mi nur petis veturon post la ponto.
Got a ride to Thessaloniki right away. Easy spot, some traffic and very slow
We used a sign with "Serres" as a Destination. Got picked up by a friendly Family after 15min and dropped of Close to the Highway going to our real Destination Thessaloniki
Ride to Thessaloniki
Good spot at the gas station to get north, everyone was quite friendly

Going out of Athenes is like going out of Paris. Good luck
The spot was great. I manage to go on the highway 🙌🏼
There is some bus stop if you are stuck too.
Stand behind the toll post so truck drovers coming through the post can see you and pick you up. You can cross the highway here so it’s easy to go in either direction.
nice elderly albanian couple who took me there. the spot is very good cause youre right in the middle of the road very visible and you can jump in the car quickly when theres not much traffic
Multaj homoj haltas apud la ŝtonarbaro.

Eliri el la urbo estas facile se vi volas iri al Ioannina aŭ al la elirejo. Mi dirus, ke valoras pli reiri al Ioannina ol provi ĉe la elirejo se vi iras direkte al Tesaloniko. Vi havas multe pli da ŝancoj atingi Grevene kaj daŭrigi vian vojaĝon aŭ eĉ Tesalonikon mem. Ĉi tie estas nur por meditantoj aŭ radikaj esploristoj .

Mi provis multe ĉe la alia elirejo sen rimarki ĉi tiun. Kio estas stulta, ĉar la alia havas tre malmulte da trafiko kaj ŝajnas esti multe pli loka, anstataŭe ĉi tiu ofertas al vi tunon da aŭtoj kaj kamionoj ĉiuj irantaj antaŭe. Mi estis veturigita per la unua aŭto iranta al Ksantio.

Mi iris al Turkio kaj iu iranta al Xanti veturigis min. Mi petis lin lasi min ĉi tie por ke mi povu provi almenaŭ iri al la sekva transversa sekcio. Bona loko por la transversa sekcio. Mi uzis 2-kilometran ŝildon.
Very wide road, a lot of people go to Athens, especially on Sunday. Plenty of space for cars to stop. You're visible from the far. A greek took me to Kifisia in Athens, nice ride.
Only reasonable spot for hitchhiking to Ioannina

Plenty of space for cars to stop, traffic light and quite some traffic. Got a quick ride up the road and got out next to the BP gas station along the highway. Big hole in the fence (can't miss it) so easy to enter station.
Top spot, short ride
Good spot after border. In the evening not much traffic, but got a ride to Florina pretty fast
A bit of a hike out of Lefkada, but perfect spot to move further. Two cars stopped within 5 minutes. First was packed until the top, second too but they took me to Nydri.
Good shady spot if stuck
Good spot to get north
There’s a gas station there and a restaurant which makes the place a perfect hitchhike spot. Two of our friends found a lift in 5 minutes and we did in about 20 minutes.
First ride over 2,000 km (2,217.0). With a woman who let me sleep in the car overnight in YU. Five stars, waiting time short, probably not at the spot that was here in 1986, and long ride.

tiny town in the middle of knowhere. the road is small and quiet. I was dropped here by a local who said this was a good route to macedonia. i seriously doubted hs judgement and was planning to bail, when a car going to macedonia stopeed! Still may have been unusual as it is very remote beyond here. driver spoke zero english but happy to talk with google translate

getting dark and not many cars, but a dude stopped and took me to pozar (well nearly). passabble space to pullover, traffic slow, good visibility. driver spoke no english but google translate and laughter did the trick.
wandering along the road, dude picks me up, english speaker. general gigachad.
first car stopped with thumb! Zero engligh bu they where nice, only a short distance but it boosted my confidence fot the day!

Waited with a Patras sign and got scooped up and taken to Nafpaktos. Heaps of room but no shade in summer (if you stand in an obviously spot). Decent spot if you get made to walk across the boarder. Most cars don’t take you and will drop you off in Kakavije even if they’re going through to Greece
We stood in front of the exit of the fairies. We had to wait half an hour because there was nobody going. When a fairy arrived we waited maybe 5 Trucks until someone took us to Patras
Perfect spot. We waited there 2 minutes and a car took us took Korce, where we wanted to go.
I and my friend (both F21) have been waiting around half hour on Monastiriou street until one guy told us to go there. It's way easier to get someone here.
Like on other islands, quite easy to hitchhike here
Although theres a big road, this one is more commonly used to get to Litochoro, all traffic goes Litochoro way.
Wide shoulder to stop
After crossing the border I was immediately approached by a group of young people who took me to Ioannina

Great spot: shadow (old bus stop), place to stop, cars not so fast cause it’s near houses
Got almost immediately a ride to mesotopos (written in greek of course)

My previous drive stopped the first car which was going to parakila: lucky! 
Nice spot, got shadow and place to stop

There is a lot of space for cars to stop and they can see you from a reasonable distance. 
You don’t really have to go this far to get out of the city but I thought it would be better.
Write in greek and count on doing small steps so writing the nearest “big” city : it worked better this way for me :)

the first car that drove past pricked me up, both up and down. Met a couple who had also hitchiked up. Seems like on this little mountain road people become more hitchiker friendly. One car was greek, the other Austrians. There where very few cars so You can hitchiker in the middle of the road.

a lot of cars passing, may not be the best spot as there is not that much room and its on a highway, tho I got lucky and one Albanian man stopped and took me around 90km towards Ioaninna. Cant find the exact spot he dropped me off, tho he was headed for Grevena and had to leave me on the highway.
good for local hitchhiking, everyone coming from the train station takes their cars to town and will take you there
I got a rode immediately towards Patras. Maybe luck don't know
Good spot to get out of Larissa. Walking distance from center, close to a Lidl. Stoplight after roundpoint, bus stop for cars to pull over.
Here you get all the tourists coming out from Olympia and the museum. Cars going slowly, shade, sooner or later someone will take you. If you're lucky you can get a long ride

Not a review for a specific spot, but rather for the island of Zakynthos as a whole--easiest place to hitchhike I've ever been. We hitched all over the island for 4 days and never had to wait more than 5 minutes. Just start walking in the direction of your destination and when a car comes by, smile and put out your thumb, usually the first car would stop, especially on the small roads between villages. Don't wait at a spot, just start walking, as cars will stop anywhere, even on narrow curves. G

To get there from Ioannina take bus number 5 from the station "Πλατεία (Προς ανατολή)" [Plateia (Pros Anatoli)], get off at "Κώστα Λιας" [Kosta Lias] and walk a bit to the spot. The bus 1,10 Euro. Lot of traffic, but to several directions, because it's not yet on the highway. But it's a good and safe spot for cars to stop. Take a sign that says where you want to go. I went to Igoumenitsa, was taken by a really nice man, who even invited me for lunch and coffee and made a detour to drop me off at

I was funnily picked up BETWEEN the Macedonian and the Greek border by two Greek guys who took me directly to Thessaloniki and were really nice. I planned on trying to hitchhike only after the border, but they just asked me pro-actively if I need a ride.
Easy ride to Athena, did not wait at all. I may have been lucky but I think its a really good spot. I also was able to sleep not far from the canal, on the opposite side.

Locals and tourists use this way to get to the coastal cities, in particular to Paralia. There is a speed limit and the road itself has a lot of small car parking lots for drivers to stop at. It is much better stop than any in the Katerini city and don’t even think of catching a ride from a train station because there are so many directions you can get from there.
There is a bus stop just after Lidl store in direction Katerini. Most of the people go to the city, so it is very easy to find a driver.
Lucky a German guy took us here. More tourists pass here, you will find someone
KOKS

The spot had okay visibility, even after sundown, but not that much space to pull over, however it felt rather safe. Only few cars pulled over and most of them were not going to Igoumenitsa. At the end we got picked Up by a nice couple who brought us directly to the port.
it will be better to hitchhike here to Athens, entrance of highway
going to the west (Igoumenitsa) there is quite a lot of traffic, we caught a ride in 5 minutes
Great spot to get to athens, a trucker took me to volos but they went on to Athens.
We were walking towards the spot we saw under the bridge and someone took us on the way to Grevena, he was going directly to Igoumenitsa. We got super lucky here
Walked util here from a place before the toll station. I thought that the drivers wouldn't see me right after the toll, so I decided to keep walking. Got a ride under this bridge up to Larissa
Bridge after the toll station. Plenty of space for car to stop on a shadow

Ni ne rimarkis ĉi tiun intersekciĝon kaj poste ĉi tiu franca paro kondukis nin 500 metrojn ĉar ili iris en la alia direkto. Sed ni estis lacaj ĉiuokaze post la 3-kilometra migrado transirante la valon.
Ankaŭ alia tre facila loko, kun multaj turistoj, multaj el Israelo, tuj post la ponto, kio faras ĝin tre facila.
Second car stopped after a minute at the spot.
Probably best place to hitchhike out of Larissa to north
Exit of the petrol station. Also wide shoulder and plenty of space to stop. Came here after waiting an hour at entrance. Still no luck
Lots of traffic, used the slip road where traffic coming from the highway goes west, just after the traffic lights. Quick ride to the A1 highway crossing.
We were two girls heading to Edessa in the morning (around 9AM). We just waited 30 minutes and people took us there.
Good spot,just be sure not to go to edessa direction if you are going north,some drivers will just pass by next intersection for MK and serbia
I needed to go to Macedonia and I confirm this is a good spot. Cars passing at this point of the road are going north, so it's likely to get a ride. I didn't have to wait that long.
hh spot to Macedonia/Serbia and Edessa. You should stay after the bridge. There are traffic lights and a lot of space to stop.
Took me two hours to get a ride, finally one truck stopped to get food from the nearby restaurant and pitied me and took me directly to my next destination- Patras
If you want to travel to Patra or Athens this spot  is very good in my experience.
After to visit Lefkvada you will smile and get a car quickly, easy to stop a car
Quite a nice spot to get off the island, except for when the drawbridge is closed :)

The spot is great (great visibility and place to stop), but I ended up waiting for quite some time to find a ride to Thessaloniki. When asking around, I even talked with a man my age who said he was going to Thessaloniki, but "refused to take strangers into [his] car because of all the problems with imigrants". Funnily enough, I was picked up by an Albanian who emigrated to Greece a few minutes later.

The easiest and quickest spot to go to Thessaloniki. The police at the borders and the people at the bar will tell you to take a taxi for the first town, don’t listen to them and put your thumb up, you’ll get a ride before noticing
200 meters after the border, I got the ride to Thessaloniki by a Turkish truck driver
I found it really hard to get a ride to Skopje. LOTS OF cars stopping but Greeks won't take you and Serbian cars are completely packed with people.

got a ride to thessaloniki with a greek guy but I wanted to keep going south, so he left me on the road before the exit to thessaloniki. However, the road after the exit is dead, nobody is driving there. I had to camp in the middle of the forest (i was with all equipment to sleep and cook). I went all the way to the second exit to thessaloniki where the cars are coming from this city towards south

I was instantly picked up by a truck going to turkey. To get to this spot, take bus 83 from the center to Langadas, then take bus 91B or 91M (I can't remember the letter sorry, but you can ask somebody to make sure) to analipsi.
The bus number is 83 from center or Lagkada Street. Ask for connecting bus to analipsi. From center to toll station u need maybe an hour, but its a really good spot for the direction turkey.
Take bus to lagkadas, then connecting bus to analipsi. Walk 20 mins until you just pass toll station. The fence dips down the hill so no one will see you Climb it. Got a Turkish trucker in 20 mins
There is a truck stop here, about 15 km east of Lagynas. Maybe the best option to go towards Istanbul with Turkish truck drivers. (untested)

Didn't get a ride here, this is not the main highway and a lot of cars are going to their villages. While we were walking towards the toll road a car stopped and bringed us 60km north from there. To arrive here we took a Train and then walked 3km

Waited a minute to get a ride up the road parallel the A1 near Afidnes. 

Took quite some time to get here from Athens by public transport, but worth the hassle.
Got a ride to the next toll station a few km north from here
Got lift to the next petrol station!
It may be the best spot to get out of Athènes, but don't expect to find somebody right away. I wanted for 5 hours there. Finally got a ride to Thessaloniki.
Didnt have a sign & spot isbt too easy to reach (takes 2 hours) from thessaloniki center. Still, worked. Lots of slow traffic

We got taken by a Romanian family after 1h30 waiting, directly to Athens! We were waiting a bit after the toll station so there was space for them to stop 👍
It's a bit adventurous to get to the toll station taking the bus 80 and then walking on a dusty road but really doable👍
Straight to Athens. So good !
A little hard to get a ride towards Igoumenitsa, Most people go t Katerini (direction Athens) but possible! We asked people while they were waiting.
you can get here from Thessaloniki by bus 80 (see page for the city), good place to catch a ride to the west towards Igoumenitsa

In my opinion it's better spot then station cuz hare is more traffic, cars are slow after toll station and there is place to stop. Better to use sign.
After an 1h Turkish truck driver took me to Turkish border.

Stand behind the toll post on the side where the trucks go through. Also check if anyone at the rest stop goes to your desired location. The highway is easy to cross, so this stop works in direction Istanbul and Athens.

About 100 minutes by bus from the city but worth it! You can walk to the rest stop and through the toll station (Not recommended) or Jump the fence Right After the station (recommended). I used a sign with the greek and turkish spelling of Turkey.
Great spot for hitching north from Thessaloniki. There are traffic lights so the cars are really slow there. We were 2 guys and had a sign North Macedonia.

-----2024----
A good spot to head for Macedonia.
The site is accessible by bus, and stop lights allow you to ask the cars where they're going.
A man going to Edessa dropped us off at the crossroads to the north 10km further on. 
Info: I'm a young man of 23.
Looked for a ride to Katerini since 18:30 or so, after 30 minutes a guy stopped next to me and asked if I want to come to thessaloniki and I said yes. We set for a beer with his friends.

Ĝi estas vere la sola parkejo inter Tesaloniko kaj Turkio kun pli da turkaj kamionoj ol aliaj permesiloj. Mi provis la aliajn parkejojn, ĉi tiu estas la sola kun deca kvanto da kamionistoj irantaj al Turkio. Tamen, por mi, neniu el ili volis helpi min kaj multaj eĉ ne volis paroli kun mi. Kelkaj aŭtoj ankaŭ haltas kaj ŝajnas, ke ili iras malproksimen, sed ili estas tre plenplenaj. Post multaj horoj mi akceptis la unuan oferton, irante al Drama (mi haltis antaŭe) kaj daŭrigis iri al Turkio iom po

best way to go to Turkey, ask the Turkish truck driver.
It may be complicated to get there from Thessaloniki city centre, you need to take the bus to Analipsi and from there walk to this rest station in about 20 mins
Sally parking close to the gates. some shade and water
This is a better spot than the gas station because you avoid all of the cars taking the alternative road, but still we got lucky.

Finally! Took about 2 hours and 3 different spots, but here we got a ride to Platamon. Best to walk here instead of the gas station if going direction Thessaloniki, because about half cars turn right here and go to villages, so you avoid those and only get the ones going far.

Two girls, we had a hard time to find anyone, the spot is not that bad but the people weren't very friendly / helpful. The area is sufficiently crowded tough. We tried all methods (asking to people / thumb / sign), thumb worked

I think durring season IT IS a good place but the people there hesitate to Pick you Up.
We waitet around 1 and a half hours Till we got picked Up by an Albanien Guy directly to Thessaloniki
A lot of chars from here. Just ask people they have time had a sign and  a smile and it was really easy also the police is really helpful and nice
Had to wait a little bit, I walked across the border from Macedonia, but eventually got picked up
Bonŝanco por eksterlandaj turistoj en ĉi tiu regiono, tio faciligas petveturadon, ĉar grekoj malamas ĝin.
Ŝajnas tre facile. Loka gvidistino, kiu kondukis sian ĉilian jogan amikinon, kondukis nin tien.
Mi pensas, ke estas tre neatendite trovi iun irantan rekte al Tesaloniko. Mi provis Gravena kaj renkontis ĉi tiun aventureman argentinan ŝoforon. Bonegaj latinaj tempoj ĝis Tesaloniko.

Mi fine povis alveni ĉi tien kaj mi pensas, ke ĉi tie estas bone sendepende de tago aŭ nokto pro kaj rapideco kaj la fido je haltigo, kiun la ilo ĉe la alia flanko generas.

La amiko iris al komotino
Facila veturo al la elirejo. Mi uzis 2-kilometran ŝildon ĉe la trafikcirklo.
We (couple) got lucky to quickly catch a ride on a highway on Friday at 5PM directly to Thessaloniki by a Greek driver, worth trying
The customs people are nice! Even in summer traffic is quite low. We were lucky to find a couple coming back from vacation in Albania!

It's a difficult place for cars to stop, but there is a traffic light and a little space at the side to stop quickly. A Greek took me from there to Chalkida and we  even went for lunch and swimming. Lucky day 🙌🏻

Spot is good if you need to go to Athens, there's a little parking area for cars to stop. I waited at a traffic light at this intersection. A Georgian worker stopped and brought me to Athens, Syntagma. Nice ride

Theres an abandoned toll booth worst case sleeping scenario, but its a small road where cars drive slowly and fairly frequently, so i didnt have to wait too long to get dropped off at the border to NM
Very nice woman, hitchhiking in Greece seems hard though
Once I approached a truck driver that was beginning to depart from the spot, I immediately got the ride.

It's a great stop to rest and catch your breath, nice man owns this place, I could charge all my devices, drink water and also he offered me free food!

Hitchhiking there was quite difficult, especially in the evening. Minimum traffic, no one stopped, even though there's a lot of place to stop.

After waiting for two hours I decided to walk down the road(I planned to walk 8 hours to Meteora), but thankfully when I was hitchhiking down the road, crazy in a good sense of words guy picked me up
Good place. Hitchhiked to Kozani. There's a lot of place, there's not much traffic and it goes a little bit too fast, but got a quick lift all the way to Kozani

I don't like hitchhiking on the highway, but there's literally no other way I could find out of Florina deeper into Greece. Got a ride pretty quickly. There's a place to stop for brave drivers, traffic doesn't go very fast and drivers see you from far away
2 people

Behind a curve, but traffic is not too fast and there's plenty of space to stop. Spot to get in/out to the temple of Hera. First car stopped, just went to the airpot, second car stopped too, jumped in for Pithagoreio.
Car can’t really stop but they go slowly. Nice spot to escape the city 🌸
Really beautiful spot, but long waiting time probably due to holidays
Good, shady spot with many cars passing by

The main road to go to the south, nice spot with place to stop and cars not to fast. But not a lot of cars to stop, we waited a lot here the day before.. 
We were lucky to find Germans !

It is a spot in the Highway, has good visibility and some time to Break. Not ideal thoough. We used a sign saying "Saloniki". We got picked up by a Truck after about 15min on the highway. He dropped us of somewhere in the suburbs.
Caught a ride halfway to Patras. Greece can be tough, but with some patience you'll get there. Good luck.
Enough space to stop, cars are slow
Solo m, short waiting time after crossing both borders (bg & gr) by foot. Waited longer beforehand between the border.
Nice spot where cars can stop at the gas station. We wanted to go to Florina and a nice Greek lady took us to Agios Panteleimonas (amazing lake), 35min from Edessa.
Lots of people going to Nafpaktos. From there you can hitch a ride to the motorway ramp behind the town. From there lots of people going to Itea/Lamia

Not too bad, most people here are only locals and not going far, or just ignore, but 1 local couple picked me up and took me to Kalamata after only 45 mins. Open side of road for cars to pull over after the turn just down from petrol station

May not seem like a great spot on google maps but in fact cars are not really fast+ they stop wherever they want in general aha (there is a small place to stop otherwise after the street lamp)
Got a ride the kallonis very quickly (with a sign written in greek and english (but, excepted during the summer, the English is not very useful : almost only locals on the island))

Waited immediately after the border crossing with a sign for Tessaloniki. We where 2 People (a girl and a guy). A truck driver took us all the way to tessaloniki and dropped us off near a bus station.
This place is fine to go south towards Nafplio (at least for me). Just be very careful please if you have to cross the road to get there
Great spot, but it's Greece, so you might be lucky, you might not. Entrance to petrol station, very wide shoulder, lots of cars going slow enough.
Cars coming off ferry from Zakynthos. Someone picked us up, but it was one of the last cars. It's all about luck.

Cars can stop, they just don't. No shade, but best place because of stoplights. After about an hour we were finally taken to Patras by Austrian tourists in a van. Autostop in Greece is mainly about luck.
Stoplight, cars going slowly, turn off spot for Olympia. Also can go in opposite direction towards Patras, just stand on other side of road
Not bad if you go to Tripoli, Athens or Corinth

It's a petrol station on the highway. If you are in Amfilochis you need to walk or hike there, but it's worth it. A good place for going south to Petra/Athens. We talked with the truck drivers and got a ride in 30 minutes (to Petras).
It is on a highway so a bit dangerous but the emergency lane is wide. All cars here have to go to Bulgaria. Note: it is illegal to stay on highway, so better catch a ride fast :)
Another good spot in Katerini, but I prefer the one closer to the city center. Some people here speed up and won’t stop even tho there is a bus stop bay by the road.

La plej bona punkto estas iom supren laŭ la deklivirejo. Nun estas flava oficiala stampo por petveturantaj lokoj. Sed vi devas esti tre kvietaj, la antaŭan nokton mi provis kaj la flava aŭto resendis min al la akselo de ĉi tiu kruciĝo, kio estas terura, tio estis nokto kaj mi laciĝis dum 3 horoj. Mi renkontis kelkajn amikojn, kiuj preterpasis post kiam ili donis al ni veturon tagojn antaŭe al Vikós. Mi rezignis kaj dormis en la forlasita konstruaĵo apud ĝi. Iom malpura. Sed komforta kontraŭ la m
Waited for about 40 mins until a very friendly guy stopped and helped me go to Thessaloniki!
Take the IKEA bus (free!) from Ioannina center, just make sure you get off at the highway (i was told to get off at ikea.. had to walk back!)
i had a lift from there within half an hour straight to thessaloniki. not the savest spot for cars to stop - but since there's not a lot of traffic its ok. just how to get there from ioannina?

It may be a good spot, just at the entrance, you can't get closer to the highway...
I might have been lucky though, but a couple of travelers gave me a lift and I didn't even raise the thumb ! They saw my backpack they understood

Can’t particularly recommend but if you get dropped here this is probably the best spot to the border. Don’t accept rides that don’t go to the border, there is nowhere else to hitchhike, I got stuck in a tiny town and had to walk 3 hours
I got a few km long ride and the guy left me on the highway, but in a safe place from which all the trucks and cars have to go to Bulgaria.
north to bulgaria. trucks are going on the way, but also many bulgarian people who work in greece.
Not the best spot for cars to stop, we were heading towards Preveza and got a ride until Missolonghi after waiting for some time
Direction: Nafpaktos, Itea, Delfi. There are traffic lights and a little bit of place for cars to stop.
Hardly any cars came through here
we walk along the road and wait around 20min
I went out of the city and I the first car stopped and gave me lift to the border.
This spot is not for Kozina direction, my mistake. Later I moved to the highway and thought it's kinda not allowed, highway was lots better
this is a big road out of florina in direction edessa and thessaloniki. you can definetly use this for hitchhiking this direction
Nears the spot cars can stop. But not a lot of car unfortunately. We where lucky probably. They drove us in ioanina. Good spot to escape the city. 🌸

Yeah you are right, (still anonymous giving his word, I get stucked about 4 hours in Igoumenitsa, so I got an overview of this experience, the north spot is bad, the south may be better and the only option)

Albanian Immigrants nearby the parking ready to steal things, some patrols doing nothing except dissuading from acting (maybe 30 immigrants "protected" by some vegetation). Something I had no idea before that it can exist..

Direction: Ioannina.
Because of some Albanian immigrants near the entrance of the highway, no cars wanted to stop. Also we ourselves felt threatened by them. Gave up after 2 hours.

It's actually a good spot to hitch from (toll station), but I was threatened they're gonna call the police. Had to walk around half an hour next to the motorway Volos way to hitch from a petrol station.

That's a good way to enter Volos. At night time, we can hh under the intersection, there's a lot of light.
Done this spot several times (more than 10), highly recomended.

Very few cars. Started walking while hitchhiking our way to Chania and we managed to get like 3 really short rides with a sign “1km” but they really helped. Cars are going slowly almost all along the road since it is hilly and a lot of serpentines.
very few cars, but i found easily someone going to volos.
Spot is okayish. No one stopped really. Sign to pyrgos did not work. A woman picked me up and drove me 15 km into the highway...

Direction south / Pyrgos / Kalamata
Take the bus number 6, ask the driver or someone to stop you at "Tofalos Stadium"
Good place, many cars, place to stop.
Nice spot in the shade, but thin traffic and you're really stuck here when not getting a ride.

There's an abandoned toll station here providing shade in summer (one could even sleep in the booths at night), good visibility and road broad enough for traffic to stop for you. Not much traffic, but got a ride to the border within half an hour.
waited for 4 hour here,pick up by serbian cuple coming back from holiday
first sunday in july. most cars are packed serbian families, but chances are you get a direct lift to skopje or belgrade.

Greek cars don't stop as usual. Many MK and SRB cars but they are packed with families. After 4h night fell and we slept in the comfy field nearby, then next border got picked up by Albanian workers. There's no water so bring plenty with you!!!

Ŝajnas esti bona kaj facila loko al Ioannina aŭ iom poste, en nia kazo, ĝis la flughaveno. Ni alvenis ĉi tien post provado de unu horo hodiaŭ direkte al Ateno kaj ĉirkaŭ 5 horojn la alian tagon en la sama loko direkte al Ateno.

The crossroad seemed like a good spot, although not many cars were going north. Also got advice from a van driver to not be close to the highway gates for a police might fine me, so I moved further to the island of the crossroad and later indeed police showed up and gave me warning not to be close to the gates.
